class_description:
The scale() and roundingMode() methods determine the precision of NSDecimalNumber’s return values and the way in which those values should be rounded to fit that precision. The exceptionDuringOperation(_:error:leftOperand:rightOperand:) method determines the way in which an NSDecimalNumber object should handle different calculation errors.
For an example of a class that adopts the NSDecimalBehaviors protocol, see the specification for NSDecimalNumberHandler.

Methods.method_description: Returns the way that NSDecimalNumber's decimalNumberBy... methods round their return values.Required.

return_description: Returns the current rounding mode. See NSDecimalNumber.RoundingMode for possible values.

Methods.method_description: Returns the number of digits allowed after the decimal separator. Required.

return_description: The number of digits allowed after the decimal separator.

Methods.method_description: Specifies what an NSDecimalNumber object will do when it encounters an error.Required.

params.param_description: The type of error that was generated.

Methods.method_declar: func exceptionDuringOperation(_ operation: Selector, error: NSDecimalNumber.CalculationError, leftOperand: NSDecimalNumber, rightOperand: NSDecimalNumber?) -> NSDecimalNumber?
